page.title: 10Sunnybank - A Voysey House
page.content: Sunnybank is a traditional Voysey House built in 1903 and originally called Hollybank. Voysey was an architect of the late Victorian age. In his life he designed many houses. Sunnybank was built next to Voysey's own house because a doctor bought the land. He not only designed the house but also all the doors,fireplaces,windows and all the iron work. It has a garden and a beautiful orchard of three quarters of an acre. Sunnybank was originally built for a doctor so the ground floor has a few rooms which were used. One as a surgery, one as a pharmacy and one as a waiting room. There are only 50 Voysey houses remaining in Britian so Chorleywood is lucky to have two fine examples. Sunnybank is located in Shire Lane a lane that goes up the hill from the village shops.
